member.name: P:Microsoft.Data.Mashup.MashupConnection.ContainerMaxCount
member.summary: Configures the maximum number of evaluation processes the Mashup Provider will use at any one time. Default is 6. Can only be set before opening a connection, or after cleaning up with MashupConnection.TryCleanup.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Data.Mashup.MashupConnection.SharedMaxWorkingSetInMB
member.summary: Configures the maximum total working set (in MB) to be shared between all evaluation processes. -1 means unlimited, which is the default. The working set of individual evaluation processes is still limited by the MashupConnection.ContainerMaxWorkingSetInMB setting. Can only be set before opening a connection, or after cleaning up with MashupConnection.TryCleanup.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Data.Mashup.MashupConnection.SharedMaxCommitInMB
member.summary: Configures the maximum total commit size (in MB) to be shared between all evaluation processes. -1 means unlimited, which is the default. The commit size of individual evaluation processes is still limited by the MashupConnection.ContainerMaxCommitInMB setting. Can only be set before opening a connection, or after cleaning up with MashupConnection.TryCleanup.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Data.Mashup.MashupConnection.ContainerMaxWorkingSetInMB
member.summary: Configures the max working set (in MB) of the evaluation processes. Default is 256. Can only be set before opening a connection, or after cleaning up with MashupConnection.TryCleanup.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Data.Mashup.MashupConnection.ContainerMaxCommitInMB
member.summary: Configures the max commit size (in MB) of the evaluation processes. -1 means unlimited, which is the default. Can only be set before opening a connection, or after cleaning up with MashupConnection.TryCleanup.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Data.Mashup.MashupConnection.ContainerTimeToLive
member.summary: Configures a duration within which an evaluation process can be reused. An evaluation is not canceled should its process exceed the time to live. The default value is null, meaning that there is no maximum duration. Can only be set before opening a connection, or after cleaning up with MashupConnection.TryCleanup.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Data.Mashup.MashupConnection.ContainerProcessorAffinity
member.summary: Configures the set of processors on which the threads of evaluation processes may run on. Can only be set before opening a connection, or after cleaning up with MashupConnection.TryCleanup.
member.remarks: On Windows machines with more than 64 processors, the processors in the array are ordered by process group. The default value is null, indicating that operating system's default behavior for assigning processor affinity when creating processes should be used. Unspecified values are assumed to be false. Array items which exceed the number of processors on the current system are ignored.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Data.Mashup.MashupConnection.ConnectionString
member.summary: Gets or sets the string used to connect to the data source.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Data.Mashup.MashupConnection.FilterDataTable
member.summary: DataTable of values to filter by. This is alternative to filtering via SQL. The columns of the table represent partition keys, for which values are provided in the rows. Each column in the table is an and, and each row in the table is an or, primarily useful when the data is partitioned.

member.name: E:Microsoft.Data.Mashup.MashupConnection.DataSourceSettingNeeded
member.summary: Provides notification that there's an issue with some security-related setting and gives the client application the opportunity to update the setting before query execution continues.
member.remarks:
Consumers need to be prepared to handle the callback on some arbitrary thread.
For a missing credential, more than one event may be fired for the same data source in multiple evaluations from the same connection/command.
Currently supports reasons CredentialNeedsRefresh and MissingCredential.

members.member: This property is to present as it would enable detecting which dataSourceSettings are used. Currently, the scenario is not publically supported.
